alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Northwest Highlands; San Francisco River Valley; Upper Rio Grande Valley; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 4:05AM MST until January 16 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Northwest Highlands, Upper Rio Grande Valley, Chuska Mountains, San Francisco River Valley, West Central Mountains, and West Central Plateau. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Northwest Highlands; San Francisco River Valley; Upper Rio Grande Valley; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau
